intro: Hisingera tweediana, commonly known as the Tweediana fern, is a species native to the wet tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help it anchor to its host while absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air. The leaves are usually bright green and have a leathery texture, which aids in water retention in its natural habitat.
